name: ref_read_url
description:
A tool that fetches content from a URL and converts it to markdown for easy reading with Ref. 

This is powerful when used in conjunction with the ref_search_documentation or ref_search_web tool that return urls of relevant content.

arguments.name: url
arguments.desc: The URL of the webpage to read.

name: ref_search_documentation
description: A powerful search tool to check technical documentation. Great for finding facts or code snippets. Can be used to search for public documentation on the web or github as well from private resources like repos and pdfs.

arguments.name: query
arguments.desc: Query to search for relevant documentation. This should be a full sentence or question.

arguments.name: keyWords
arguments.desc: A list of keywords to use for the search like you would use for grep

arguments.name: source
arguments.desc: Defaults to 'all'. 'public' is used when the user is asking about a public API or library. 'private' is used when the user is asking about their own private repo or pdfs. 'web' is use only as a fallback when 'public' has failed.
